According to Sport, our offer for Coutinho has be in total € 160 m.

Coutinho is close to joining Barça. A meeting took place on Friday and Saturday which finally allowed negotiations to start.

Coutinho is close to joining Barça. A meeting took place on Friday and Saturday which finally allowed negotiations to start.

Liverpool have accepted that Coutinho is going to leave and have already created a roadmap for the last few days in the window.

LFC will first find a replacement. Liverpool are in advanced talks with Bayern for Sanches. Once he arrives, Coutinho will be sold.

Liverpool want €160 million for Coutinho, with at least €130 million fixed.

Coutinho never told Brazil he was injured. He will play in the WCQs and will arrive in Brazil to train with the squad on Monday. [sport]

Barça are thinking of selling André Gomes to be able to afford Di María from PSG, a player the technical team like. [sport]

Barça tried to offer Gomes to PSG as part of a swap deal, but they weren't interested in signing him. [sport]

On Saturday there was a meeting between Juventus and Barça regarding Gomes. Juventus offered about €33m, but Barça wanted €50m. [sport]

Signing Di María does not mean Coutinho will not come. Barça want both as they have realized they need more attacking prowess. [sport]

Seri: "I feel bad, I will not lie. I'm very touched. My dream of going to Barça has been broken and this, for me, is terrible."

Seri: "For me, football is a joy. I did not play for Nice this weekend because I did not have my head set on football."

Seri: "The negotiations were broken because the talks between the clubs went from bad to worse."

Seri: "From what I have been able to find out, it wasn't because of a technical decision or for financial reasons."

Seri: "I tried to not think about negotiations before the Napoli game, but I couldn't forget that Barça were here to finish my transfer."

Seri: "I don't make excuses, I just want to make clear how I felt before the CL game. I tried to focus, but it was impossible!"

Seri: "I am a player who likes to organize the game, to command, to press, but I just couldn't be 100% focused."

Seri: "I was meeting for over an hour with Barça's board on Tuesday. They didn't tell me anything about the progress of my signing."

Seri: "I went home happy. I was excited that I would become a Barça player. The next day, I heard the news."

Seri: "I was stunned to see that that the operation had all of a sudden broken down. I went to Nice's offices and exploded with anger!"

Seri: "The leaders of Nice didn't say anything to me. They didn't even look me in the eye. It was clear that something had happened."

Seri: "They promised me one thing and it turned out they didn't keep their promise they made with me. They asked more money from Barça."

Seri: "I want to be optimistic and I think it can still happen. Let the two clubs come together quietly again and come to an agreement."

Seri: "I want to play for big European teams. Before Barça, Roma had many offers. The operation failed because of financial reasons."

Seri: "Roma's leaders got tired of Nice's board! Roma was a good choice, but Barça is my dream. The team I've always supported."

Seri: "I saw myself playing at the Camp Nou. My agent returned with a 5 year contract offer. Barça represents my childhood dreams."

Seri: "The way Barça play, their style. I saw myself playing with Messi, Iniesta and other extraordinary Barça players."

Seri: "I was happy when I saw Xavi's comments about me. It was an honor that someone like him, from my dream club, spoke that way about me."

Seri: "It was a magical feeling to read his words. My wish is to meet you one day in person and thank you for everything you said about me."

Seri: "If Xavi was the one to start Barça's interest in me, I have to thank the great Xavi Hernández."

Seri: "Things were going very well for me lately. I won the best African Player of the Year and was in the Best XI of Ligue 1. Now... this."

Seri: "I'm going to say one thing very clear. I'm not afraid to go to Barça. I've been a fan since I was a kid. I know how big the club is."

Seri: "People say Barça ruled me out because of the Napoli game? Wrong."

Seri: "Now I'm going to be the one who asks you a question: Do you think Barça will pay €30m for a player they do not know? Hmm... no."

Seri: "I've received lots of support from Barça fans. They have tried to cheer me up. I deeply appreciate that."

Seri: "I was also told Òscar Garcia, Saint-Etienne coach, felt sorry for what happened to me. Coming from an ex-Barça, it reached my heart."

Seri: "I thought about not playing in the Napoli game to force my transfer. But I decided to fight for my club."

Seri: "If I didn't play, I wouldn't have been loyal to my club. I need Nice to have the ball to express my qualities. That didn't happen."

Seri (when asked about what he thinks will happen now): "I will wait and leave my destiny in the hands of God."

Seri: "I love Barça and no matter what happens, I will always support them, even though what happened damaged me. Let's wait and see."
Seri

Seri: "I feel bad, I will not lie. I'm very touched. My dream of going to Barça has been broken and this, for me, is terrible."

Seri: "For me, football is a joy. I did not play for Nice this weekend because I did not have my head set on football."

Seri: "The negotiations were broken because the talks between the clubs went from bad to worse."

Seri: "From what I have been able to find out, it wasn't because of a technical decision or for financial reasons."

Seri: "I tried to not think about negotiations before the Napoli game, but I couldn't forget that Barça were here to finish my transfer."

Seri: "I don't make excuses, I just want to make clear how I felt before the CL game. I tried to focus, but it was impossible!"

Seri: "I am a player who likes to organize the game, to command, to press, but I just couldn't be 100% focused."

Seri: "I was meeting for over an hour with Barça's board on Tuesday. They didn't tell me anything about the progress of my signing."

Seri: "I went home happy. I was excited that I would become a Barça player. The next day, I heard the news."

Seri: "I was stunned to see that that the operation had all of a sudden broken down. I went to Nice's offices and exploded with anger!"

Seri: "The leaders of Nice didn't say anything to me. They didn't even look me in the eye. It was clear that something had happened."

Seri: "They promised me one thing and it turned out they didn't keep their promise they made with me. They asked more money from Barça."

Seri: "I want to be optimistic and I think it can still happen. Let the two clubs come together quietly again and come to an agreement."

Seri: "I want to play for big European teams. Before Barça, Roma had many offers. The operation failed because of financial reasons."

Seri: "Roma's leaders got tired of Nice's board! Roma was a good choice, but Barça is my dream. The team I've always supported."

Seri: "I saw myself playing at the Camp Nou. My agent returned with a 5 year contract offer. Barça represents my childhood dreams."

Seri: "The way Barça play, their style. I saw myself playing with Messi, Iniesta and other extraordinary Barça players."

Seri: "I was happy when I saw Xavi's comments about me. It was an honor that someone like him, from my dream club, spoke that way about me."

Seri: "It was a magical feeling to read his words. My wish is to meet you one day in person and thank you for everything you said about me."

Seri: "If Xavi was the one to start Barça's interest in me, I have to thank the great Xavi Hernández."

Seri: "Things were going very well for me lately. I won the best African Player of the Year and was in the Best XI of Ligue 1. Now... this."

Seri: "I'm going to say one thing very clear. I'm not afraid to go to Barça. I've been a fan since I was a kid. I know how big the club is."

Seri: "People say Barça ruled me out because of the Napoli game? Wrong."

Seri: "Now I'm going to be the one who asks you a question: Do you think Barça will pay €30m for a player they do not know? Hmm... no."

Seri: "I've received lots of support from Barça fans. They have tried to cheer me up. I deeply appreciate that."

Seri: "I was also told Òscar Garcia, Saint-Etienne coach, felt sorry for what happened to me. Coming from an ex-Barça, it reached my heart."

Seri: "I thought about not playing in the Napoli game to force my transfer. But I decided to fight for my club."

Seri: "If I didn't play, I wouldn't have been loyal to my club. I need Nice to have the ball to express my qualities. That didn't happen."

Seri (when asked about what he thinks will happen now): "I will wait and leave my destiny in the hands of God."

Seri: "I love Barça and no matter what happens, I will always support them, even though what happened damaged me. Let's wait and see."
